alert.note: Alert for Benton; Jasper; Newton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 05 at 5:02PM EDT until August 05 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT/11 PM EDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Indiana, including the following areas, Benton, Jasper and Newton. * WHEN...Until 10 PM CDT/11 PM EDT/ this evening. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Roads and streets may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and thunderstorms with very heavy rain are expected to occur in a narrow corridor across east-central Illinois into portions of northwestern Indiana through early this evening. Rainfall rates over two inches per hour are likely with the heaviest showers. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch for flash flooding means rapid-onset flooding is possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Flash flooding is a dangerous situation. Persons with interests along area rivers, creeks, and other waterways should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
